posts.post:
Anyone gotten depersonalisation from smoking weed?
I have just quit weed because I feel like I may have developed depersonalisation from it, I used to suffer from it years ago but it gradually went away, since I quit I have felt anxious and everything that I felt years ago. Has this happened to anyone else?  I also have no appetite and can barely eat which is a big deal for me because I have had eating disorders over the years and it makes me scared I will end up in hospital again. Did anyone else lose their appetite after quitting and how long did it take to return? It makes me want to smoke again just so I can stomach food.
posts.Post Summary:
The dominant maladaptive self-state is characterized by an anxious affect stemming from a sense of feeling trapped. On one hand, using weed has led to a regression into depersonalization, which they have experienced in the past. On the other hand, stopping weed leaves them feeling vulnerable to the return of past eating disorders. Additionally, there is a subtle self-critical voice regarding their history of eating disorders.

The subtle adaptive self-state is reflected in their search for help and a desire to engage in self-care.

B-S.highlighted_evidence: It makes me want to smoke again just so I can stomach food

A.highlighted_evidence: since I quit I have felt anxious

C-S.highlighted_evidence: I also have no appetite and can barely eat which is a big deal for me because I have had eating disorders over the years

posts.post:
When I eat I am so starving an later I feel sick.
For example when I eat a grilled cheese sandwich, I will eat it and be full but an hour or 2 later I am so starving I feel really sick and panicky. I have asked my gf and family and they all said that it doesn't happen to them so it's made me worry that I have a medical issue or something. Is it normal to be so hungry when just an hour before you felt full? I'm a 22 year old male btw.  EDIT: title is meant to say an hour later, sorry.
posts.Post Summary:
Elements of an adaptive self-state can be recognized in his effort to engage in self-care by seeking reassurance about whether his situation is normal.

An element of a maladaptive self-state is evident in the anxiety he experiences regarding his eating habits.

B-O.highlighted_evidence: Is it normal to be so hungry when just an hour before you felt full?

A.highlighted_evidence: it's made me worry that I have a medical issue or something.

posts.post:
Help interpreting my 23andme results.
Hi guys, I have Anxiety and issues with my gut and the doctors can't seem to help me and SSRI drugs don't have much effect so I decided to see if 23andme could tell me anything, it's just that some of it is hard for me to figure out. Can someone here help me figure out what it all means and what supplements I should take? I am so desperate atm.  http://i.imgur.com/wYJrdUe.png
posts.Post Summary:
The maladaptive self-state is characterized by an anxious affect and a belief that neither he nor doctors or medications can fully help him.

The adaptive self-state consists of efforts to seek help from others and take steps to help himself.

B-O.highlighted_evidence: Can someone here help me figure out what it all means

C-S.highlighted_evidence: it's just that some of it is hard for me to figure out

C-O.Category: (2) Perception of the other as detached or over attached
C-O.highlighted_evidence: the doctors can't seem to help me and SSRI drugs don't have much effect

posts.post:
Can't handle the feelings in my head anymore.
I have OCD, Panic disorder and GAD. I can't get a job because I can only leave the house for about 10 minutes at a time. SSRI drugs don't work they just give me migraines, the doctors don't seem to be able to help unless prescribing me things. I am stuck in this tiny town in the middle of nowhere in Australia and have no easy access to mental health services.   I am broke because I can't work and my gf and mother have to support me which makes me feel worse, eventually they will get sick of it and I'm sure I'll be on my own. Maybe it's just time to end it and finally stop the torture my mind goes through every single day.
posts.Post Summary: A dominant maladaptive self-state is evident in the post. The writer expresses hopelessness about his situation and is self-critical about his mental health struggles. He perceives others, including doctors, his mother and his girlfriend as either unable or unwilling to provide the help he needs, which intensifies his feelings of distress and leads him to contemplate self-harm.

A.highlighted_evidence: Can't handle the feelings in my head anymore

C-S.highlighted_evidence: eventually they will get sick of it and I'm sure I'll be on my own

C-O.Category: (2) Perception of the other as detached or over attached
C-O.highlighted_evidence: the doctors don't seem to be able to help

D.Category: (6) Expectation that competence needs will not be met
D.highlighted_evidence: Maybe it's just time to end it and finally stop the torture my mind goes through every single day.

posts.post:
Serotonin Syndrome from Curcumin and SSRI
I have been taking longvida Curcumin with my 50mg of Zoloft the last week and have felt odd, really weird up and down with emotions and muscle twitches. I googled and realised Curcumin is an MAOI and then I found this thread on Longecity http://www.longecity.org/forum/topic/69489-escitalopramssri-curcumin-serotonin-syndrome/  I'm quite scared, I haven't taken the Curcumin today so will I be okay? is it even possible to get serotonin syndrome?

Can't handle what goes on in my head anymore.
I have OCD, Panic disorder and GAD. I can't get a job because I can only leave the house for about 10 minutes at a time. SSRI drugs don't work they just give me migraines, the doctors don't seem to be able to help unless prescribing me things. I am stuck in this tiny town in the middle of nowhere in Australia and have no easy access to mental health services.  I am broke because I can't work and my gf and mother have to support me which makes me feel worse, eventually they will get sick of it and I'm sure I'll be on my own. Maybe it's just time to end it and finally stop the torture my mind goes through every single day. If I don't at least get out of the town I'm in soon I probably will have to.
posts.Post Summary: A dominant maladaptive self-state is evident in the post. The writer expresses hopelessness about his situation and is self-critical about his mental health struggles. He perceives others, including doctors, his mother and his girlfriend as either unable or unwilling to provide the help he needs, which intensifies his feelings of distress and leads him to contemplate self-harm.

A.highlighted_evidence: Can't handle what goes on in my head anymore.

C-S.highlighted_evidence: I'm sure I'll be on my own

D.highlighted_evidence: Maybe it's just time to end it and finally stop the torture my mind goes through every single day.

posts.post:
Anyone tried Baclofen for anxiety?
I have just ordered some because I'm desperate and I can't handle the sexual side effects of SSRIs, I am having panic attacks daily and besides Valium I have nothing to take for it, has anyone tried Baclofen?
posts.Post Summary: The adaptive self state in the post is comprised of relating behavior in the form of advice seeking from the forum. The maladaptive self state is composed of very anxious affect caused by the writer not taking his SSRIs because of their side effects.

A.highlighted_evidence: I'm desperate and I can't handle the sexual side effects of SSRIs, I am having panic attacks daily and besides Valium I have nothing to take for it,

timeline_summary: The self-states in this timeline appear to remain relatively stable. Across different posts, a dominant maladaptive self-state is evident, characterized by a strong anxious affect, but it is almost always accompanied by a subtle adaptive self-state focused on seeking improvement, either through the help of others or his own efforts. This adaptive voice is subtle yet consistently present in most of the posts.
